title: Polynomial Terminology Builder
description: Drag and drop each polynomial into its correct structure category: Monomial, Binomial, Trinomial, or Other Polynomial.

categories.name: Monomial
categories.description: A polynomial with exactly one term (no plus or minus been unlike terms). Example: 5x², –7, 3a⁴b³.

categories.name: Binomial
categories.description: A polynomial with exactly two unlike terms joined by plus or minus. Example: x + 2, 3y² – 5y.

categories.name: Trinomial
categories.description: A polynomial with exactly three unlike terms joined by plus or minus. Example: x² + 3x + 2.

categories.name: Other Polynomial
categories.description: A polynomial with four or more unlike terms joined by plus or minus. Example: x³ + 2x² – 5x + 7.

instructions: Enter your name and start the game.
Choose the number of polynomials you want to solve.
Your task is to classify each polynomial into the correct category (e.g., monomial, binomial, trinomial, other polynomial).
Click a polynomial to select it, then click the category where it belongs.
If you make a mistake, you can move polynomials been categories.
When you finish, click the Submit button to see your results and score.
Try to get as many correct as possible and see your name on the leaderboard!
